title: CRISPR/Mobile Element Recognition Feature
description: This feature detects elements associated with prokaryotic immune systems and mobile genetic elements, particularly CRISPR spacers and transposases. It shows sharp activation spikes precisely at or near these elements, which function in bacterial defense against foreign DNA. The activation pattern is highly consistent across examples, occurring at junction points between host genomes and mobile elements or defense systems. This likely represents the detection of sequence signatures that distinguish self from non-self DNA in bacterial genomes, which is critical for genome integrity and defense against phage infection. The feature could be identifying key sequence motifs that mark these regions as targets for defense systems or recognition sites for integration/excision machinery.
